HIGHLY RECOMMEND! Without a doubt, this place is a 10/10. Lee Ann’s home was VERY clean. The pictures does no justice on how beautiful her property truly is. Lee Ann provide us with a welcome bag, clear instructions and suggested restaurants. Located about 3 miles out from the nearest town, this place was perfect. A beautiful big backyard, plenty of room in the house, board games and a study room; my family truly had a blast. Thank you Lee Ann for all the updates, I look forward to re-booking with you in the near future!
My family loved staying in Lee Ann’s home. It was the perfect size for us. The home is very comfortable and we loved the location. She was very accommodating and accessible.
Great place and location for our fishing tournament. Host was very helpful and quick in response to any questions I had. Will stay again.

We loved staying at Lee Ann’s place! Super clean, spacious and close to town. This home had everything we needed for our stay in Bainbridge. Loved the peaceful surroundings and the flexibility of check in and check out. Highly recommend!

Lee Ann’s house is decorated tastefully and has everything to make you feel right at home. The beds are SUPER comfy and the work space was a perfect area that could be closed off from the rest of the house so you’re not disturbed. We were in town for a fishing tournament on Lake Seminole and this house is only about 10 min from the boat ramp and the same to downtown.
Lee Ann also left very thoughtful gifts at check in…a goodie bag with some necessities and sweets, makeup remover in the bathrooms, etc.
Great host and great house. 10/10 would recommend.
I have stayed at quite a few places with Airbnb and by far this has been the best because it is so clean and peaceful. Lee Ann is a wonderful host, responsive and so helpful.
Great will try and stay again if we ever go again..
Host was very quick response to emails questions and we were allowed to extend stay with short notice
Second time staying here and it is always a pleasure. Everything is extremely clean and all the necessities are readily available if you prefer to stay in and cook.

I highly recommend LeeAnn's Airbnb. It was perfect for me and my family as we gathered for Thanksgiving. perfect location very peaceful quiet out in the country. She has a beautiful home and was very responsive and even left a goodie bag which was perfect. We took a recommendations and went to a nearby restaurant for lunch with me and my family. The beds were very comfortable and the house was spacious enough room for us and we even got to cook breakfast. It was just like being at home. Everything that we needed was there and we love the swing. On Saturday we sat out all day Enjoy the weather and took lots of pictures. Lastly, I was able to catch up on much needed rest. again I highly recommend Leanne's Airbnb The price was just right, the location was perfect and everything was so nice and beautiful. God bless you Lee Anne and hope to see you again next year.

My brothers and I stayed at Lee Ann’s place for a weekend reunion. It was AMAZING! The beds were comfortable, the rooms were spacious, and there was ample room to unpack. We didn’t get to use the kitchen but it’s beautiful and looks to have everything we’d need. We would definitely stay here again.

This house is so well maintained and immaculately clean. The owner is very responsive to any needs (we did not have any). There is a farm next door which our children loved watching the horses and goats. Lots of yard for us to enjoy the weather and time with family. We will be back and looking forward to it.
Beautiful house in a quiet little area.
Very well appointed home in a quiet agricultural area. The house was very clean and well appointed.

Great location, quiet, surrounded by farm land and very close to down town and the boat basin. Plenty of yard, and an awning, if you are bringing a boat. This is the bass capitol of Georgia. Just right for a family of 4-5 or a group of adults, same size. Plenty of kitchen community space.

We really enjoyed our stay. We loved the location and the house was nice and clean. Thanks Lee Ann!

Great place to stay Bainbridge! Very clean and well stocked. Lee Ann was very responsive. It's in farm country but only 10 mins to downtown, also beautiful sunrises and sunsets! Highly recommended!
Great place to stay. The pictures don’t do this place justice. It is beautifully decorated, clean, and well equipped. Beds were super comfy. I would definitely stay here again. Thanks Lee Ann!
The property was beautiful. Very spacious with all the amenities.

The house accommodated our every needs. It was spacious, clean, and well stocked. The beds and pillows were soft and comfortable. We even enjoyed taking the chairs out of the shed and gazing at the animals next door while sitting under the shade in the huge yard surrounding the house. I would booked this place again and again. The host left a lovely welcome bag and checked in on us right before we arrived. Her directions were easy to follow. She even provided suggestions on local places to eat.
Great home right outside of town quiet and super clean.

Great house. The house was roomy and very clean. Would stay again.
This is a perfect house. Super clean, beds are very comfy, quiet surroundings for a great nights rest. Highly recommend this home to folks traveling in this area.
Very nice accommodations. Close to restaurants and less than 10 minutes from the boat launch.

You will not be disappointed by this property! It is very well appointed and clean. It had everything we needed and then some. You can tell they took time, effort and care into getting this home ready for guests. Lee Ann was beyond wonderful as a hostess. She left a goodie bag out for us and made sure we had thorough instructions and information for our stay. I cannot say enough great things about this property!
Great accommodation, great host with awesome communication. I highly recommend to anyone staying in the Bainbridge area!
This home is beautiful, very comfortable, and extra clean. Lee Ann was helpful and kind. Our family of 5 adults and a baby thoroughly enjoyed our stay.
The house was nothing short of amazing! Location was perfect very spacious home and the beds hug you while you sleep LOL!!! We will definitely stay with Lee Ann the next time we are in town!
Our stay at Lee Ann's home was amazing. It was a beautiful, peaceful location. The home was very clean and inviting with beautiful furnishings.

Nice quaint little tiny home on the water. clean. quiet and peaceful. Definitely bring your fishing gear. wifi is weak so it gives you a chance to "unplug". Will definitely look at staying again if we're back in the area.
This is a great getaway! Beautiful place and so peaceful! I will definitely book again.
Great place to stay!
Beautiful place. Would love to come back. Great fishing off back porch
Perfect place to stay. So clean and well thought out with everything you need. Will definitely stay here again.

We arrived at night and had difficulty finding the house. Entry is from the rear which was not lighted. The keycode lock was difficult to operate but Michele was very responsive with assistance. The house was convenient to town and restaurants and shopping but there are no sidewalks so not walkable. The location was two houses from a major intersection and on a main road and we were able to hear a lot of road noise. The house was immaculate and minimally furnished. One of the bedrooms did not have a nightstand or lamp and in another the bed was against the wall and difficult to access for two people. The mattresses were on the soft side for our particular liking. We did run out of toilet paper and garbage bags and could not find any extra in the house but did not bother Michele with this. There are two tvs but we could not access regular tv channels. There are brick steps and walkway to enter the house and these are uneven and slippery in the rain.

Celebrating a graduation from FSU and this was a wonderful place to stay for the price! Quiet surroundings and easy to get to Tally. My parents found it easy to access the house and bathrooms. Had everything we needed.. and more!

The house was really pretty; loved the sun porch. We visited Bainbridge for a cousin's wedding; the house was spacious and nicely decorated...looks just like the photos. The downtown square was adorable, and we enjoyed shopping in the quaint shops and eating in the local restaurants. Michele was very responsive and friendly. I would happily stay at her place again.
Wonderful house with close proximity to the downtown area which has some cute shops and a really good restaurant. It was a great place for us to stay for our niece’s wedding at Southwind Plantation.
THE PLACE WAS VERY CLEAN AND NICE EVERYTHING WORKED🥰🥰
very inviting home that seems newly renovated. nice landscape. could use a coffee table but perfect other than that.

We spent 10 days in this super cute house and felt right at home. Convenient location made it easy to visit with family and friends and we enjoyed starting our mornings in the sunroom. Michele was thoughtful and easy to communicate with- we'd definitely stay here again!
2nd time staying here, great house!

Michelle was a great host as usual. This was my second stay at her home. My first day was during Christmas to spend time with my sister that passed away after Christmas and Michelle allowed us to stay at her beautiful home again I wanna thank you so much for the hospitality and the opportunity to stay in your home.

The home was perfect for our family of five. We were only there for one night, but my girls enjoyed the layout of the home. The master bedroom has minimal furniture, but that was fine. The home fit our needs for our short visit to Bainbridge. My family also enjoyed relaxing at the main square in Bainbridge. Thanks for letting us stay at your place!
Great house with everything we needed. Super clean, great kitchen. Perfect for our work trip, we’ve already booked again!

Michele’s House was the perfect little getaway spot, that was cozy and had us feeling right at home. We really appreciated the holiday decorations to make it feel more festive. We will definitely be staying here again in the months to come.
Michelle was a great host and I enjoyed the comfort of her home. We recommend her home whenever you visit Bainbridge.

This was a wonderful stay in Bainbridge, GA. It was updated beautifully and decorated perfectly for the Christmas holiday. The property was easy to find and close to a major retail shopping area with great food options as well. The host was very understanding and helpful with my reservation flub and it made all the difference for my family. We will always look for this property to book again when we visit family in Bainbridge.

Home was impeccably clean. Very roomy and well maintained. Beautifully accented and private. Instantly feels like you’re at home. We’ll being staying here every trip to Tallahassee. Can’t wait to come back, many thanks!
Great stay! Will return again.
Great stay!

Had a lovely stay at Michelle’s place. She was very kind and responded quickly to questions. The house was nicely decorated, updated, and very clean. It had everything we needed. We especially enjoyed sitting in the sunroom.

I have NEVER stayed anywhere away from home that was so immaculately clean and fresh! We loved the house! A gorgeously renovated home with the charm of original woods floors and I think the cabinets were probably original too. The modern touches to update were spot on. Everything was super comfortable and everyone had their own space (family of 5).
A great pizza restaurant was less than a mile away and lots of other places to eat, shop as well. We will definitely be looking to stay here next time we’re down south for an FSU game!!

We visited Bainbridge for a memorial service, a somber occasion that made the warm energy of Bainbridge Beauty all the more precious to us. From the moment we arrived, the property offered a sanctuary of peace and comfort.
Location is everything, and here, you’re perfectly situated in a tranquil area yet accessible to local spots. Cleanliness was impeccable, setting a welcoming atmosphere from the get-go. Check-in was effortless, guided by comprehensive instructions provided in advance.
The comfortable king-sized bed was a haven for restful sleep, and the fully stocked kitchen met nearly all our culinary needs, missing only wine glasses. But the true gem was the sunroom—its stunning views and abundant natural light served as a soothing backdrop for reflection during our stay.
Overlooking this spot would be a missed opportunity of the highest order; your soul will haunt you for bypassing such an experience.
This home was Beautiful. Truly a hidden gem in a quiet town. We will definitely be staying here again.

We have officially deemed this our vacay spot. Michelle and her associate were awesome. She extended hour check out time, possessed understanding towards my OCD. She would not allow me to clean up…she insisted on us enjoying our time.
We will be staying as often as we can. THANK YOU SO VERY MUCH!!!!!!

The Cove was just what my family needed. We had plenty of space for parking, sleeping, and relaxing on a long weekend. We enjoyed time together on the large dock, several meals cooked in the kitchen, and quality time sitting around talking or watching a family movie. The location was just as described, and William was always quick to respond to any messages sent.
This house was perfect for our first time in Bainbridge. Clean, quiet and spacious.

This place is full of family history and it’s probably as close to its original state as it can be; well taken care of. The screened in porch was a family favorite! Neighbors are also nice and full of knowledge about the area. The house has plenty of room for families.
The only downfall for us wasn’t about the house but fishing from the dock was not successful at all in our 6night stay; which was the main reason for booking a lakefront property. Locals say a boat is needed for good fishing. I think we missed the spawning as this is the area gosh come to spawn March-April (we found out later).
We did enjoy early mornings watching the wildlife; geese, ducks, gators, herons, squirrels, and cardinals. This is such a peaceful area and we will be back…with a boat!
There is a marina right around the corner if you do bring a boat!
We only ate out once during our stay&can 100% recommend Bonnie Blue House in Bainbridge!
Meat House for your meats, their smoked pork chops are delicious!

Enjoyed our stay very much. This is the third time we've stayed at the Cove.

Great place to stay as a bass fisherman. The home is cozy and exactly as it is listed. We absolutely loved the large dock space, twin porch swings (screened in to keep those bugs out) and the cleanliness inside and out. A couple things we found to be a little unfortunate were the lack of cupboard space due to how much unnecessary kitchenware etc is stored. Not really an issue for a short term stay but it was a struggle for us when staying about a month to find places to store our food other than on the counter. The only other issue was the size of the covered bays on the dock. There are two covered bays to park a boat both with working lifts which is great however they are too small to fit mostly any bass boat. We have a 2019 triton 20’ and it only got about 1/3 of the way under before being stuck in between the sides of the dock. This is not a deal breaker by any means as you can still park alongside the dock perfectly fine just uncovered. Overall very nice place and will return.

Rolled into town for the Bassmaster elite series. Williams place is by far the best place to stay on lake Seminole with lake front view and ample space to view park a handful of trucks and boats with ease.
Whenever we roll back into town we will for sure be booking again
This was our second visit to the Cove, and we plan to return. It's a comfortable, large lake house.

We have stayed at The Cove twice now, and will definitely use it again. We typically have 3 families. Plenty of room for everyone. Ample parking. Peaceful neighborhood. Always clean. Lovely lake themed decor. A great place to stay!.

Amazing place with boat dock access. Nothing beats listening to the noises of nature and waking up to fish! Would 10 out of 10 recommend this place.

My husband and I took my mom and little sister to the lake for Mothers day weekend and stayed in Williams house on the cove. We couldn't have asked for a more perfect place to stay. The home was big enough and had enough room where each one had our own space and bathroom, it was quiet and private, had a beautiful dock for fishing, was right around the corner from a boat ramp to launch the boat and was stocked with everything we could have needed from plenty of linens to any thing you might need to cook in the kitchen... We enjoyed the swings on the screened in back porch and the rocking chairs on the dock with a beautiful view of the peaceful little cove.... We visited the antique shops and a couple of parks in Bainbridge, cooked dinner on the charcoal grill that was provided, and fished from the dock when he wasn't out on the lake in the boat. It was a very peaceful and relaxing time at the lake and my mom loved it, and communication with William was great. He is even mailing my husbands fishing hat to us that he forgot.. I can't say enough about how perfect this place was for our needs for a weekend get away and how much we appreciate William allowing us the use of his beautiful home... We hope to return again one day....
Great place to relax and enjoy family time! The house was perfect for our family weekend getaway for my daughters graduation.
This was a perfect place for our family get together! Everything was nice and clean and comfortable. The host is extremely friendly and flexible. We had an amazing time and would love to come back!
Wonderful lake house! Fabulous guests! My family and I had the best time. Big enough to spread out and a very comfortable space. The dock and boat slips were A+. We hope to return.
A buddy and I stayed here for a week of fishing! We had a great time and the house was very nice. A bit big for the two of us but location was perfect. We caught some good fish too! Would recommend!

This house was perfect for my family! We were able to use the dock for our boat. It was nice and convenient to have power to plug in the batteries over night in the boat slip. We hope to return soon for another adventure!
Affordable, clean, spacious, comfortable home right on the inlet. Our group wants to go back!
Great location, plenty of room and gorgeous views. Would definitely stay there again.

It’s a lovely peaceful getaway. The night sky and mornings watching the lake was quite beautiful. Will plan on returning if available.
Great stay!
A laid back place for big family's. lots of space beautiful place. my family and loved it.
Great place great price very understanding.

The Cove is the perfect Lake House. If you are looking for a laid-back relaxing getaway for a large group this is the house for you. The porch and deck are perfect for drinking coffee and watching the breathtaking sunsets. Our kids enjoyed fishing off the dock and playing in the large yard. Also there is a nice lakeside firepit. We can't wait to return.

Everything was just perfect for our family!! Coming to Bainbridge for a wedding from Fort Walton Bch, Bradenton, Palatka, FL & Dothan, AL there was room for all 10, with each having their own private space.
And three bathrooms helped, LOL. Firepit on Friday night just when the cold front came in was so much fun! Fully equipped kitchen (might take out a few of the colanders & put in another larger cast iron skillet :) If we needed anything all we had to do was look around and we found it.
Was reassuring when William called me the night before to see if we needed anything. Highly recommend!!!! Would be excellent choice for a fishing weekend or week!! We caught a couple off the dock, but this one was all about the wedding.
William is very kind and accommodating and his home is breath-taking. Perfect place to just get away and relax!

My family and I had a wonderful time at the cove !
Everything was as advertised.
William answered all questions I had soon after asking.
I highly recommend this place.
We definitely plan staying there again if available during our next vacation!
Thank you very much William!

We had a great time at the Cove. It was very comfortable and peaceful. The house is well stocked and had more than enough room for our party of six. William is a great host and responded to all questions in under 2 minutes. The yard was cut the day of arrival and the house was spotless. Plenty of room to park vehicles and trailers. We really enjoyed fishing off your dock and watching the alligators and turtles. Lots of chairs available to relax. We caught bass, bluegill, crappie, channel catfish, gar and a shad right off the large dock. Having the opportunity to use two boat lifts is above and beyond. Access to the big water is only a couple minutes away by boat. Mac's Point boat launch and restaurant is right around the corner. Great food! Lots of weed in September, but the fishing is good. I saw a couple of huge bass, but they weren't interested in my offering. To many bluegill around for them to snack on. Highly recommend staying at the Cove if your looking to relax in a peaceful neighborhood and enjoying Lake Seminole.
Place was great, well stocked, clean, good communication with William. Thanks again

William, his family, friends, & neighbors are all great people, and there to make sure all of your needs are taken care of. Fortunately, we had no needs.....So it was just nice to know they were there if needed. William is a great communicator and answers all inquiries in a timely manner. Do your self a favor and take your family here for some peace and quiet. Davey and family.

This home was perfect for a relaxing weekend getaway. It was clean and cozy. Had a table with hand sanitizer as soon as you walked in. Being lake front with a private dock made it even better. Communication from host was timely. Would definitely stay here again!

Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at The Cove, south of Bainbridge. The home is in a peaceful spot on the lake, and provided a comfortable experience for our large family (7 adults and 3 children). We were all very pleased with the accommodations.
The Cove was a perfect get away. The house is right on the water. There house had everything we needed to enjoy our vacation.

The Cove was everything we had hoped for. The calmness of the neighborhood, the peacefulness of the lake, the coziness of the home, the hospitality of the owner— every aspect of this visit was a blessing. We hope to come back soon (and hopefully our fishing skills will have improved then).

Better than what I expected we can’t wait to rent again for when they come down again to visit. They responded right away and kept in touch to make sure I didn’t have any questions AMAZING! Thank you so much great Mother’s Day weekend!

Such a lovely place! Really relaxing being able to make a cup of coffee and sit on the back porch swings or even the rocking chairs out on the dock. There is plenty of space in this house, not that we were inside all that much! Very cozy lake house which was great for our small group of friends.

I stayed for 2 nights with my husband for a relaxing vacation for my birthday in November. This little boathouse is so cute and relaxing. It is nicely decorated has everyting you need and more. The master bed is soft and comfy, but if you don't like being wakened by the sun in the morning, bring a sleep mask. I made due by tieing a scarf arond my eyes after being awakened early the fist morning. There is a window near the cealing without a curtin and the curtain on the sliding glass door lets in alot of light. The bunk room is darker with one small window with wood blinds. The bottom bunk is very firm. The living room is very comfortable, there is cable TV, but I don't like TV. I connected my roku but the wifi signal was to week to stream on roku. But I was happy streaming on my phone using my data. Next time I will bring a cable to connect my phone to the TV. I spent most my time on the back porch doing embordiey and watching the ducks, fish jumping, and boats passing by. The space heaters and extra blakents came in handy on the back porch in the chilly November mornings and nighs. We did not leave, as I read there us not much to do in town but a couple of parks. I have chronic fatigue and pain, so I was satisified just staying at the boathouse. The houseboat is somewhat accesiable for people with mobility issues. There are no steps leading to the boat house. I had no problems geting there with my power wheelchair. The is one big step down from the dock to the boathouse entrance about 1 ft. I used my 4ft long ramp and cane to get down the step. I did not feel safe with my heavy power wheelchair on the ramp. Although a lightweight wheelchair or walker would probaly be fine on a ramp. However the doorways are much to small for any wheelchair or walker, you can only use a cane. There are no steps inside the boathouse and a very low threshold for the shower, about 4in. I would recomend this place to anyone looking for a relaxing vacation.

Totally EXCELLENT not-so-tiny house on water!!! Lots of cleaning supplies—-yay! Close to everything in town (quick drive). Lots of towels and toilet paper (so appreciated bc I have 2 kids!), ACs cooled entire house beautifully, and there were even popsicles and cans of water in the fridge—-very thoughtful! I could smell a grey-water-type smell in the bathrooms when running the shower and for some time afterward, but my kids didn’t smell it...and I did become nose blind to it after a few hours. I recommend to other visitors that keeping the 2 bathroom doors closed to contain the heat of the dehumidifier in the 2nd bathroom seems to help the ACs to not work too hard. I booked this houseboat bc I mistakenly thought we could swim off it—lol—but as the kids were changing into swimsuits I spotted a gator about 10 feet from the back porch...so I don’t recommend that, but still loved this houseboat and recommend it!

I visited under the worst possible circumstances you could imagine. I was in the area to teach a 2 week hazmat class for a local industrial plant. My stay was during the time the Flint River was flooding and coincided with the nationwide coronavirus outbreak. The marina docks were essentially made an island by the flood waters with no walkway access to them. Our hosts informed me of this in advance & offered a refund to stay elsewhere. I declined the refund & they rigged up a Jon boat ferry system from the shore to the dock. I’m glad I stuck with them because the boathouse is amazing. It is Wonderfully decorated, had Comfortable furniture & all comforts of home. It’s truly a place you could picture yourself living full time, or at least as a vacation home. Unfortunately, my stay was cut short a week by the corona virus outbreak just as the flood waters were receding. When I informed Travis & Desta of the situation, they offered to block out a week for me when the class is rescheduled. With luck, the next trip won’t involve flood waters and a national emergency. Either way, my experience was great & an adventure to say the least. It may have even turned Bainbridge into a vacation destination. Final note: Stay here. You’ll love it!!
